comment.author: 27331537@N06
comment._content:
I was just reading back through the comments under this image. Beachcomberaustralia [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] you may well already know this, but just a quick note to clear up any confusion others may have regarding the comment on the quality of the print we have digitised being so different to the quality of the glass plate digitised by the Powerhouse Museum and linked via  Beachcomberaustralia at the top of this feed. 
This print and the others in this series (NRS4481) are contact prints produced from the original glass plate negatives held by State Records NSW. The print was not produced from the glass plate held by the Powerhouse Museum hence the differing qualities of the images.
-AG

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/state-records-nsw] Aha! Sorry, I was wrong about the Powerhouse Museum "original" (above) - evidently those Rocks photos in the Tyrrell Collection are copy glass negatives made from prints (who, why, when?). Something I had not grasped before, and not clear on the PhM blurbs. Thanks to [http://www.flickr.com/photos/47201412@N02/] pellethepoet for explaining it and pointing me to these comments - www.flickr.com/photos/state-records-nsw/4585556880/ There are several extra Rocks photos in the Tyrrell Collection which do not match up with State Records versions. Is this because Series 4481 is not yet fully digitized yet? Bring it on!
